Open Source Ruby on Rails Course

lessons mini-lessons prework projects resources skills style terminology

Resources

This is a list of learning resources that we will use during the course and that the students will use in their future learning and work. The resources mentioned here are "primary" sources and will generally exclude any blog entries or StackOverflow answers. Those links, where relevant, should be included in the lesson content under the Further Readings header.

==============================

Ruby Documentation
  • Ruby-Doc.org
  • RubyDoc.info
  • Ruby User's Guide
  • Ruby-Lang
  • Cheat Sheet: Ruby
Rails Documentation
  • RailsGuides
Rails And More
  • RailsCasts
  • Code TV
"Getting" Ruby
  • Ruby Koans
  • Ruby Tapas
  • Why's Poignant Guide*
  • Ruby Monk
  • The Bastards Book of Ruby
  • Confreaks
  • Ruby5
Online Classes
  • Codecademy
  • Code School
  • Treehouse
  • Thoughtbot
  • UT on Rails
Ruby Exercises
  • Programmr
  • CodeQuizzes
  • Codewars
  • LearnStreet's Ruby Projects
Ruby/Rails Tutorials
  • rubylearing
  • tutorialspoint: Ruby
  • General Assembly's Ruby on Rails for Devs Course
Books
  • Michael Hartl's Ruby on Rails Tutorial
  • Learn Ruby The Hard Way
  • Practical Object Oriented Design in Ruby
  • Programming Ruby 1.9 - 2.0
  • Eloquent Ruby
IDEs (Integrated Development Environments)
  • Sublime Text
  • Vim
  • RubyMine
  • Emacs
General
  • Bento
Run Code
  • Ideone

* For those of you who are curious about the story of why the lucky stiff, this article is a good start.
